WorkItem.Description:
I've created a new WPF application and used nuget to install MVVM Light. The default MainViewModel states in a comment that the "mvvminpc" snippet is available to add bindable properties.

However, typing this snippet doesn't actually do anything nor does it show up in intellisense. How can I make it available?
WorkItem.Summary: mvvminpc snippet not available after nuget-based install?

Comments.Message:
Hi,

Nuget does not currently have a mechanism allowing to install snippets or templates. You are right that the comment mentioning mvvminpc is confusing. I will remove it.

Thanks
Laurent

Hello,

Just looking for this snipped for a few minutes, before finding this post. Could you add the snipped, or a link to it in the class?

Fabrice

I am using VS Express 2012 for Windows Phone on Windows 8 Pro, installed the MVVM Light and the snippets is not showing.  There is a solution to manually add the snippet, but couldn't found the folder.

If you use the NuGet version then you can simply make your own snippet, based on the standard prop snippet. I have attached the one I use. In Visual Studio, open Tools/Code Snippet Manager, select C#, and press 'Import'. Then select the file.
The snippet becomes available as 'propmvvm'.
